Hot Works Fine Art and Craft Shows have earned recognition 18 times from national magazines and artist organizations as one of the “Top 100 Art Shows in America.” Artists who have worked with us often describe us as “family.”
We understand how valuable your time is, so we’ve streamlined the application process to help you focus on creating art. Returning artists who have participated in five shows within the last three years can skip the jury process with just a phone call! For our Florida shows, we offer a convenient “Fly and Show” display rental option, perfect for out-of-state artists or those who prefer not to handle the setup of Light Dome tents and Pro-Panels—we’ll take care of it for you!
The Hot Works Difference
From the moment you arrive at a Hot Works show, the difference is clear. Our team welcomes you with a smile, chilled water, snacks, and the support needed for a successful event. We genuinely care, and our mission is to ensure your experience is both enjoyable and financially rewarding. We go above and beyond to make everything as smooth as possible! Our show locations are carefully chosen for their proximity to affluent neighborhoods, luxury homes, and five-star resorts in Florida. After two decades, our flagship event, the Orchard Lake Fine Art Show in West Bloomfield, Michigan, attracts a second generation of art patrons. At many of our shows, you’ll have the convenience of parking directly behind your booth, allowing easy access to your work throughout the weekend. For those flying in, we offer pre-order rental options for Light Dome tents, Pro-Panel walls, and jewelry cases to simplify your setup.
Artist Amenities
Friday move-in for a stress-free setup.
Complimentary snacks and water throughout the show.
Booth sitters available to give you a break when needed.
Convenient parking directly behind or near your booth.
Full tent and wall booth setup packages available.
Pre-show marketing. support to help drive traffic to your booth.
Competitive booth fees.
Returning exhibitors (with 5 shows in the past 3 years) can bypass the jury process.
35+ years of event production and media expertise.
Strict policies in place to prevent buy/sell/import vendors.
Overnight security for your peace of mind.
A professional event crew dedicated to supporting you.
Advertising & Marketing
When the show opens you’ll discover the benefits of a high-level marketing and advertising campaign. Every show draws the most affluent art patrons in the region. From TV commercials, radio, newspaper articles, road signage, banners, digital and social media advertising, and email blasts to our huge list of quality art patrons
The Search for A Great Show
How do you know a show is good for you? The answer is in the number of returning artists. Twenty years after our first show launched… we’ve learned how to promote and produce shows that keep artists returning year after year.
Our History
Over the past two decades, we’ve grown a large list of loyal patrons and developed successful marketing strategies and partnerships that attract a wide range of affluent, buying patrons to our shows. It’s the reason why so many of our exhibiting artists return year after year to Hot Works shows.
Quality & Authenticity
Artists rely on us for keeping out the buy/sell and import fraud. Our juried selection process is supplemented by interviews, references, and raw materials supplier information to assure our patrons and artists of quality. The quality and authenticity of the art presented are important to us. When there’s any question, we deal with it!
National Honors & Awards
Hot Works Fine Art & Craft Shows are consistently ranked as some of the best-juried art shows across the United States.
Top 100 Art Shows in America – Orchard Lake Fine Art Show (Michigan)
Top 100 Art Shows in America – Boca Raton Fine Art Show (Florida)
Top 100 Art Shows in America – Estero Fine Art Show (Florida)
Top 100 Art Fairs in America – Art Fair Sourcebook
Community Outreach
Our nationally acclaimed events bring people together to inspire local creativity, create a bridge of diversity and grow cultural awareness and tourism. Each show features a youth art competition to expose and educate students on how they can sell their art and earn a living from making it.
Our Partners, Press & Vip Friends
With a career background in media buying, we leverage every penny of your booth fee to create the strongest visibility in every community. Our media buy always includes television commercials, social media, banners, and local partner distribution of posters, postcards, and real estate signs surrounding the area.
Results
Cities embracing smart growth strategies recognize that art and cultural events create prosperity and build a sustainable local economy. Our fine art shows draw collectors and affluent visitors regionally and nationally. Beyond the art purchased at the fair, our out-of-town patrons spend more than $623 daily in the local economy.
What Artists Say…
If you want to know the quality of a show, just ask the professional artists who rely on us to provide them with a sustainable way to make a living. Here’s what one artist said…
“Sarasota Fine Art Show was one of my best Florida shows last season – great turnout.”
David Campbell,  Venice FL
Sculpture,
“Orchard Lake Fine Art Show is a wonderful show – we will do it anytime.”
Julio Garcia, Orange Park, FL
Painting
“Thank you, Patty!! I love doing your shows! Everyone is so talented and nice. All of your artist work so well as a team.”
Judy Crowell
Painting

About Us
Patty Narozny
Founder & Executive Director
Hot Works Fine Art Shows Founder, Patty Narozny,
entered the art world in 2002 with a unique set of media qualifications that enabled her to organize, market, produce, and curate the submissions for her award-winning fine art and craft shows. Armed with a B.S. in Corporate Finance from Detroit’s Wayne State University (1986), she started as comptroller for Detroit’s alternative art-heavy newsweekly, which led her to a management position at Detroit’s NBC affiliate, a pivotal point in Ms. Narozny’s career.
It was at NBC WDIV in Detroit where she learned the fine art of media negotiation, which largely accounts for the extensive media coverage her shows receive on the most limited of budgets. Combining strategic media buys with social media and digital marketing, Narozny has run hundreds of commercial spots in the regions where each of her shows is held.
Success came early when in 2006 Narozny’s flagship Orchard Fine Art Show was voted one of America’s Top 100 Art Fairs by Sunshine Artists Magazine. Today, Hot Works Fine Art & Craft Shows in Boca Raton, Estero/Fort Myers, and Orchard Lake/West Bloomfield have been recognized nationally in the Top 100 Art Fairs in America list.
Hot Works media partnerships created the seeds for success which allowed Narozny to expand and create Institute for the Arts and Education, a 501c-3 non-profit for community outreach programs, and the nationally recognized Youth Arts Competition held at each Hot Works Fine Art & Craft Show.
Over the years, Narozny has built a loyal following of nationally recognized artists and art patrons due to her high standards of quality and her determination to keep her show 100% authentic original fine art and fine handcrafts made and represented by the artist in person. The nationwide presence of imports and buy/sell products are so prevalent in today’s art fair scene that many shows have just given up trying to maintain authenticity. Narozny sees this as a break in the trust that art patrons expect from any quality art show. While it’s an ongoing struggle, Narozny keeps an eye on the forged and fake “art” coming into this country and trusts her artist exhibitors to assist in the effort to keep every piece of art shown at Hot Works Fine Art Shows authentic.
She is one-of-a-kind in the world of art fairs. Ms. Narozny and her husband, both avid gardeners, reside in White Lake, Michigan.

Jim Sobczak
Jim has been an integral part of live television productions for 35+ years.
Jim is currently the director for the Detroit Pistons in-venue show since 2014 as well as the Detroit Red Wings director for the inaugural season at Little Caesars Arena. He directed the NHRA drag racing series that airs on Fox Broadcasting Companies and FS1 for two plus years.
As the technical director for many live TV sports, including NBA, MLB, NHL, NFL pre-season games, NASCAR, American LeMans as well as many corporate events with General Motors, Ford and Chrysler (now Stellatus), Jim has had a rock-solid background in technically implementing and executing the always challenging multi-camera and multi-record broadcasts.
Jim’s career has also been creatively enhanced by his editing skills. Winner of five Michigan EMMY awards for outstanding editing, in multiple categories, while working with the Detroit Pistons. Other great projects include.
Jim’s collaboration as editor on a Howling Diablo’s “Funk Hand” production, that earned Outstanding Video / Independent Budget (under $10,000) at the 2016 Detroit Music Awards. Jim’s love of the visual arts has complemented and naturally led to his association and development of the Hot Works shows and brands.

Jim’s career has also been creatively enhanced by his editing skills. Winner of five Michigan EMMY awards for outstanding editing, in multiple categories, while working with the Detroit Pistons. Other great projects include.
Jim’s collaboration as editor on a Howling Diablo’s “Funk Hand” production, that earned Outstanding Video / Independent Budget (under $10,000) at the 2016 Detroit Music Awards. Jim’s love of the visual arts has complemented and naturally led to his association and development of the Hot Works shows and brands.
